thread.title: B-Sens win the 2015-16 opener against Albany 4-1
thread.title_full: B-Sens win the 2015-16 opener against Albany 4-1

title: B-Sens win the 2015-16 opener against Albany 4-1
text: B-Sens win the 2015-16 opener against Albany 4-1 10/10/2015 (Updated 10/11/2015 12:20:09 AM) BINGHAMTON, N.Y. – The Binghamton Senators opened their 2015-16 regular season with a big 4-1 victory over the visiting Albany Devils. Binghamton’s power-play unit opened the scoring 9:48 into the first period when Colin Greening redirected a shot from Patrick Mullen past Albany ’s Yann Danis. The Devils tied the game 1-1 with just over six minutes to play on the power play when Joseph Blandisi managed to poke home a loose puck under Driedger’s right pad. The teams skated the majority of the second period tied 1-1 before O’Dell notched his first of the game with less than 1:30 to play in the frame. Tobias Lindberg skated up ice with O’Dell in a two-on-one rush against Danis and dished a cross-crease feed to O’Dell who one-timed it into the back of the net to give Binghamton the 2-1 lead heading into the final break. David Dziurzynski increased the B-Sens lead to 3-1 just 3:40 into the third period when he took a feed from Mike Kostka behind the net and beat Danis clean over his glove hand for his first marker of the season.
